alert.note: Alert for South and East Jackson, Larimer, North and Northeast Grand, Northwest Boulder Counties Above 9000 Feet; South and Southeast Grand, West Central and Southwest Boulder, Gilpin, Clear Creek, Summit, North and West Park Counties Above 9000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 26 at 6:22AM MST until December 27 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...SIGNIFICANT TRAVEL IMPACTS EXPECTED WITH QUICK HITTING STORM SUNDAY... .A fast moving storm system will bring hazardous travel conditions to the mountains on Sunday. Snow will increase this morning, and will be heavy at times especially during the middle of the day. Strong winds and considerable blowing snow will combine with the falling snow to produce near blizzard conditions at times. Road closures will be possible. Snow will decrease by late afternoon or early evening, but slick roads, lighter snow, and areas of blowing snow will continue through Sunday night. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches. Wind gusts of 40 to 55 mph will be common, with gusts in excess of 70 mph above timberline. * WHERE...Rocky Mountain National Park and the Medicine Bow Range, and The Mountains of Summit County, the Mosquito Range, and the Indian Peaks. * WHEN...Until 5 AM MST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult, with intermittent road closures possible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility with near blizzard conditions at times, especially this afternoon.
info.instruction: Consider altering your travel plans to avoid travel during the worst conditions, from late morning through this afternoon. If you do travel, carry extra food, water and fuel along with warm clothing. Be prepared for slow travel and possible road closures. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org.
